definition: deficiency of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: Objective:To study the mechanism of coronary heart disorder heart Qi belonging to deficiency and blood stasis type treated by tonifying Qi and invigorating blood decoction.
sentences.chinese: 探讨益气活血汤治疗心气虚血瘀型冠心病的作用机制。

sentences.english: For those who has a weak digestive system or having diarrhea, please avoid over dosage.
sentences.chinese: 有气虚胃寒，食欲不振及腹泻的患者应避免过量食用。

definition: deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
depletion of the spleen (Chinese medicine)
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
stagnation of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
stomach cold (TCM)
a person who is in poor health cannot handle sth so strong as a tonic
(in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
night sweats
collapse of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
loose bowels/diarrhea/to have the runs
diarrhea
clotted blood/extravasated blood (leaking into surrounding tissue)/thrombosis
anemia
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
uterine bleeding
